subject: add systemd dbus service and run it as 'bluetooth' user
commitMessage:
add systemd dbus service and run it as 'bluetooth' user

bluetooth-service daemon needs to have 'User' smack label.
dbus-daemon is not able to set smack label when activating a dbus service.
So add a systemd dbus service allows to launch bluetooth-service with 'User'
smack label and then create .bt_userprivileges file in relevant place.

Also use 'bluetooth' dedicated user to run bluetooth-service daemon.

Bug-Tizen: TC-1972

Change-Id: Ic4db6f896e7d6ff2f6d2e94d533779dae595dee0
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

In general, I agree with the patch.
But I need to make sure the NTB service can be started on demand. When some of its interface got called.
I do not want it run on system start. 
Thanks!

Patch Set 1:

Of course NTB comms dbus service is still activated at run time and not at startup.

But dbus service can not set smack label whereas systemd dbus service can do it. This is necessary to allow NTB daemon creates .bt_userprivileges file when needed.

The latest problem here is to know how to start obex dbus service...

subject: store bt user privileges in /usr/share/bluetooth-frwk directory
commitMessage:
store bt user privileges in /usr/share/bluetooth-frwk directory

HOME environment variable is not forwarded in bluetooth-service process context when
this daemon is spawned by dbus activation. So bluetooth-service daemon was not able
to create .bt_userprivileges file in home directory.

As bluetooth-service daemon will be owned by a dedicated user, there is no home
directory, and so let's move it to /usr/share.

This patch replaces 'app' user by 'guest' user in order to run it on Tizen Common
which doesn't have 'app' user.
It also handles smack labels and directory ownership.

Bug-Tizen: TC-1981

Change-Id: I80968817ca5872b6b79b22ed120821e7987a1846
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The patch can work.
But I suggest to set the privileges directory in building time, and keep the /usr/share/bluetooth-frwk as the default directory.
So it is easy for user to pick other directory if porting to other platform.
Thanks!

Patch Set 1:

My concern is to store .bt_userprivileges file in a folder, that 'bluetooth' can modify. 'bluetooth' user has no home folder.
According to what I see in Tizen filesystem, /usr/share/ seems  coherent.

Please tell me where you want to see this file stored ?

subject: Bluetooth-Service/Profiles: Load/unload OPP feature module at runtime
commitMessage:
Bluetooth-Service/Profiles: Load/unload OPP feature module at runtime

Users always use Bluetooth to scan and pair remote devices. OPP features
is not always to use, only used when user need to send file. So many time,
OPP module do not need to load into memory, when user use it, then load into
memory and unload when send file over.

Change-Id: Ic0000a50bd16c1546f2e64a11486cc0983541133
